object_name: Buddhist embroidery (shūbutsu), mounted as hanging scroll
text:
繍仏 shūbutsu

Three large Sanskrit characters, under a golden canopy and resting on lotus pedestals, represent the members of an important Buddhist triad: the buddha Amida (center) and his attendant bodhisattvas Seishi (lower left) and Kannon (lower right), the same trio that appears in the Welcoming Descent painting nearby. Banners on either side of the canopy read, “All who praise Amida will attain salvation” (left), and “The light of Amida illuminates the entire world” (right). This embroidered scroll, which also depicts vases of flowers and ritual implements on a table below, would have taken the place of an actual Buddhist altar for the purpose of personal devotion.
title: Embroidered Amida Triad in the form of Sanskrit Syllables
